Introduction

The AM263x package consists of MCAL Drivers & Applications for AM263x family of devices. The MCAL modules are compliant to AUTOSAR specification versioned 4.3.1. This is a bugfix-release of specific MCAL drivers and not the final release of the product.

Licensing

Refer to AM263x manifest at top level and [HTML] for AM263x Manifest

Getting Started

The AM263x User Guide [HTML] provides the documentation and references necessary to begin development on TI's platforms using AM263x.

Documentation

Refer to following documentation for further details:

AM263x User Guide This document details Supported driver, Installation, Dependencies, Build instructions, Steps to run example applications, Module Specific User Guides and others [HTML]
MCAL Configurator User Guide Refer this before attempting to reconfigure MCAL modules. This include steps to Install Configurator (EB), Configurator Licensing, Generation of MCAL Configurations and others

What's New

Bug fixes done and additional features tested to improve testing coverage in the release.

  • Supported SoC: AM263x
  • Validated MCAL modules: PWM, ADC, PORT, ETH / ETH TRCV, WDG, MCU, CAN, SPI, ICU, DIO, GPT, FLS
    • The above MCAL driver could be hosted on any R5F core.
    • Sample Example Application for above drivers
    • Elecktrobit Configurator to configure above driver

    Device Support

    SoC HOST (OS) Test Platform
    AM263x Windows / Linux, EB configurator only on Windows AM263X CC

    Validation Information

    Validation of example applications for the below mentioned features done. Mcal modules are tested standalone for example applications provided. Full functional testing is not performed in the release.

    Driver Features Tested
    ADC 1. Software Triggered Group Conversion
    2. Notification for the Group Conversion completed
    3. One-Shot Group Conversion
    4.Hardware Triggered
    5. Continuous mode Conversion
    6. Streaming mode
    7. Polling mode conversion
    CAN 1. CAN FD Frame Format
    2. CAN interrupt and Polling mode
    3. CAN Standard and Extended Frame
    4. External Loopback
    5. CAN testing for other Baudrate(500k/2.5Mbps/1Mbps/5Mbps)
    PWM 1. PWM Pulse Generation with Default Configured Parameters
    2. PWM Duty Cycle Variation
    3. PWM Freqeucy variation
    4. PWM Interrupt generation
    5. PWM HR PWM (Enabled by Pre-Compile)
    ETH / ETH TRCV 1. Receive Test in interrupt with CANoe (1000Mbps/autonegotiation)
    2. Transmit Test in interrupt with CANoe (1000Mbps/autonegotiation)
    3. Filter test for receive: Adding MAC address to filter, removing MAC address from Filter
    4. Unicast, Multicast, Opening filter(Broadcast) Controller mac address (configured)
    5. Time Stamp: Egress and Ingress timestamp with ptp packets
    6. Statistics
    MCU 1. Clock Enable
    2. Initialize RAM Section and Verification
    3. WakeUp Cause
    PORT 1. Intialization of All PORT pin
    2. Changing direction of PORT pins
    3. Input invert testing
    WDG 1. WDG Reset
    2. Window mode: 100%
    3. NMI method
    4. Reset Verification
    SPI 1. Async Mode loop Back Testing
    2. SPI Controller Peripheral loopback
    ICU 1. Measurement mode
    2. Edge Detection mode, Edge Count
    DIO 1. Write Channel
    2. Read Channel
    3. Write Port
    4. Read Port
    5. Write Channel Group
    6. Read Channel Group
    FLS 1. Flash Read, Write
    2. Erase
    GPT 1. One shot and Continuous mode for Timers interrupt

    Dependencies:

      • EB Installer ($MCAL_INSTALL_DIR/mcal_drv/mcal_config/Elektrobit/installer)
      • EB License Administrator ($MCAL_INSTALL_DIR/mcal_config/Elektrobit/installer)
      • EB Documentation ($MCAL_INSTALL_DIR/mcal_config/Elektrobit/installer)

      Fixed Issues

      ID Issue Type Description
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4192 Bug [PORT] Port module missing QUAL, INP_INV_SEL configurations
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4188 Bug [ETH]: Eth: Include Structure is not compliant according to AUTOSAR
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4187 Bug [ETH]: ETH_OS_COUNTER_ID always generated to EthDefaultOSCounterId even if EthOsCounterRef is configured
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4186 Bug [ETH]: EthDemEventParameterRefs generated to ETH_DEM_NO_EVENT even if EthDemEventParameterRefs configured
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4185 Bug [PWM]: Pwm symbolic names are generated wrong (PwmConf_PwmChannelConfiguration_PwmChannel_0 instead of PwmConf_PwmChannel_PwmChannel_0)
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4184 Bug [PWM]: The file Pwm_Irq.c uses the macro PWM_CFG_ISR_TYPE to decide which ISR category is used. But this is not defined within Pwm. Only PWM_ISR_TYPE exists.
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4183 Bug [ADC]: All values of AdcGroupIds are pre-configured to 0 and cannot be changed in EB tresos.
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4298 Bug [ADC]: Adc app's SoC_enableReference( ) API not working properly
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4248 Bug [WDG]: wdg_app.c not checking the reset reason after ther reset
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4269 Bug [MCU]: SYS_STARTUP.ASM: SYS_RST_CAUSE is not getting cleared
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4270 Bug [MCU]: MCU: Incorrect Mcu_GetPlatformResetReason
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-3612 Bug [CAN]: Compilation error for CAN module when Loopback is disabled
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4182 Bug [SPI] Unexpected delay for each 32 bytes transfer in TX/RX mode
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4181 Bug [SPI] MCSPI FIFO Byte Depth is not correct
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4180 Bug [CAN] Default Nominal and Data baud rate configuration is not correct
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4171 Bug [Port]Output/Input Override control configuration is incorrect
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4170 Bug [Port]Slew Rate Control definitions are incorrect
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4246 Bug [SPI]ExternalDeviceCfgId assigned is incorrect when multiple SPI jobs use the the same external device
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4191 Bug [ICU]Redundant FUNC_TEXT_SECTION like macros to be removed
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4190 Bug [ICU]Memory section start for TEXT section is not closed
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4189 Bug [ICU]ECAP source files does not include memory map sections
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4178 Bug [ICU] Interrupt enable configuration based on capture event is not configurable
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4175 Bug [ICU]: Number of ICU channels configured is not calculated correctly during code generation
      SITARA_MCU_MCAL-4174 Bug [ICU]: ICU interrupt service routine is not running in arm mode

      Upgrade and Compatibility Information

      Driver Compatibiltiy Information Comments
      ETH Eth_Types.h file is added, Eth_GeneralTypes.h and EthTrcv_Types.h files are updated as per 4.3.1 Autosar SWS.
      Number of Tx buffers changed to 24 (from 255), number of Rx buffers changed to 48 (from 255) in the configuration to optimize the memory       		-
      PWM Pwm symbolic names are updated from PwmConf_PwmChannelConfiguration_PwmChannel_0 to PwmConf_PwmChannel_PwmChannel_0 -
      PORT Added INP_INV_SEL, HSMASTER, HSMODE and QUAL_SEL functionalities. -
      PORT Changed Pin Output Override Control and Input Override Control type to ENUM. -
      ICU Added new configurable parameter Interrupt Enable on Capture event. -
      MCU New Reset reasons added in Mcu_Platform.c: MCU_DEBUGGER_RESET, MCU_WARM_RESET_TEMP0, MCU_WARM_RESET_TEMP1, MCU_WARM_RESET_WDT3.
      Updated sys_startup.asm file by clearing SYS_RST_CAUSE_CLR with 0x7U instead of 0x1U.       		-
      CAN Default CAN configuration baud rate is updated to 1Mbps/5Mbps and 500kbps/2.5Mbps with sampling point greater than 85% -
      WDG Default configuration parameter reaction is changed to NMI -

      Technical Support

      For technical support and additional assistance, visit or [E2E] contact local TI Field Application Engineer

      Package Versioning

      Each package version is composed of 3 period-delimited numbers - represented here by the letters M, m and p [M.m.p]. The table below provides a descriptive reference regarding package version numbering.

      Digit Meaning Description
      1 (M=Major) Major revision Incremented when the new version is substantially different from the previous For example, a new module added or an existing module's algorithm significantly altered.
      2 (m=minor) Minor revision Incremented when the new version has changed but not in a major way. For example, some minor changes in the API or feature set.
      3 (p=patch) Patch number Incremented for all other source code changes. This include any packaging support code.
